title: 106_hr767
content:
The "Middle Class Tax Relief Act of 1999" amends the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. Amendments made by section 3 are not considered changes in tax rates for section 15 purposes. The Congress finds that a budget surplus is expected, and a plan to reduce debt and provide tax relief should be implemented. SEC. 3. REDUCTION OF INCOME TAX RATES; ELIMINATION OF MARRIAGE PENALTY. Amends Section 1 to impose taxes on married individuals filing jointly and surviving spouses based on a specified table. The tax rates based on taxable income are as follows:
- Not over $70,000: 15% of taxable income
- Over $70,000 but not over $104,050: $10,500 plus 28% of the excess over $70,000
- Over $104,050 but not over $158,550: $20,034 plus 31% of the excess over $104,050
- Over $158,550 but not over $283,150: $36,929 plus 36% of the excess over $158,550
- Over $283,150: $81,785 plus 39.6% of the excess over $283,150. Heads of Households are also subject to these tax rates. Heads of Households are subject to a tax on their taxable income according to a specific table. Tax rates for unmarried individuals are based on taxable income brackets. For income not over $52,600, the tax rate is 15%. For income over $52,600 but not over $89,150, the tax is $7,890 plus 28% of the excess over $52,600. For income over $89,150 but not over $144,400, the tax is $18,124 plus 31% of the excess over $89,150. For income over $144,400 but not over $283,150, the tax is $35,251.50 plus 36% of the excess over $144,400. For income over $283,150, the tax is $85,201.50 plus 39.6% of the excess over $283,150. Tax rates for unmarried individuals are based on taxable income brackets, with different tax rates for various income ranges. The tax rates range from 15% for income not over $52,600 to 39.6% for income over $283,150. Tax rates for married individuals filing separate returns are also based on taxable income brackets, with rates ranging from 15% for income not over $35,000 to 39.6% for income over $283,150. Married individuals filing separate returns are subject to a tax based on taxable income brackets, with rates ranging from 15% to 39.6%. Tax rates for taxable income range from 15% to 39.6% based on specific income brackets. Tax rates for taxable income range from 15% to 39.6% based on specific income brackets. Every estate and trust are subject to a tax determined by a table under this subsection. Tax rates for taxable income range from 15% to 39.6% based on specific income brackets for estates and trusts. The tax provisions are amended by changing the year from 1992 to 1998 in various sections, including Section 25A(h), Section 32(j)(1)(B), Section 41(e)(5)(C), and others. The tax provisions are amended by changing the year from 1992 to 1998 in various sections, including Section 513(h)(2)(C)(ii), Section 685(c)(3)(B), Section 877(a)(2), Section 911(b)(2)(D)(ii)(II), Section 2032A(a)(3)(B), Section 2503(b)(2)(B), Section 2631(c)(1)(B), Section 4001(e)(1)(B), Section 4261(e)(4)(A)(ii), Section 6039F(d), Section 6323(i)(4)(B), Section 6601(j)(3)(B), and Section 7430(c)(1). Amendments also include changes in Section 42(h)(6)(G)(i) and Section 6334(g)(1). The amendments made by this section apply to taxable years starting after December 31, 1998.
